## What is Antenna Theory: Analysis and Design by Constantine A. Balanis?
  
Antenna Theory: Analysis and Design by Constantine A. Balanis is a classic textbook on antenna engineering that covers the fundamental principles, concepts, methods, and applications of antenna theory. It is widely used by students, researchers, and practitioners in the fields of electrical engineering, communication engineering, and electromagnetics.
  
The third edition of the textbook was published in 2005 and features updated material on topics such as smart antennas, microstrip antennas, fractal antennas, aperture antennas, horn antennas, reflector antennas, and antenna miniaturization. It also includes more than 1200 problems and exercises with solutions and answers.
